comment: Was very rude and condescending with questions from students the first week of classes. Seemed like she was more interested in listing her credentials/accomplishments than getting to know her students an develop any sort of rapport with them. I knew within the first week she was not someone I trusted. I'm a Deans List student, but, umm no thanks.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Get ready to read! Attendance is highly important! The book is a necessity in order to pass the class! Make sure you take notes on each chapter she lectures over. Shes often scattered when lecturing so it can be confusing when trying to study material. Ask questions frequently if you dont understand. she often has a attitude and shes unorganized

Her attitude definitely made not want to attend class. She expects you to be knowledgeable about every single thing in the textbook. I rarely read the textbook and just did the study guide and ended the class with a B. The VNP may sound super intimidating but it's not all the bad.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: She was hard on us. There are four tests and she drops lowest test grade. They were not too bad in my opinion and I didnt even read the textbook. She says you have to read to pass but you only need to do the study guide. There is a group project that you are creating all semester that is a little difficult and you have to present it later.

WORST TEACHER EVERRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRR! OMG I CANNOT BELIEVE IVE TAKEN THIS CLASS TWICE AND STILL FAILING IT I DO ALL MY WORK ON TIME PLUS ALL HER GROUP PROJECT STUFF SHE MAKES US DO. ITS LIKE IF YOU DONT GIVE HER EXACTLY WHAT SHE WANTS THAN YOUR JUST OUT OF LUCK. THE ONLY THING IVE DONE GOOD ON IS THE BONUS QUIZZES WHICH STILL DOESNT HELP MY GRADE.

Dr. Wade-Berg cares about her students and she is there to push you forward. Her class isn't hard, but it also isn't easy. As long as you read the tests are easy. The group project was great, but also required allot of time. You truly learn what you are in school for with Wade-Berg. I would most definitely take her again!

Material was hard to locate and was not organized. Two of the major assigments were group work. Try to select a good group. Test were difficult. There was not enough time to complete each answer. Feedback was discouraging. Never knew when grades would post. Hard to get in touch with professor.

The online format is lengthy disorganized and complicated.  Outside of the textbook reading.  Project drafts are not graded in a timely manner, even though there is a "due date" and a  "close date".  Exams can be hard with the essay questions at the end. (note if you do take her class. Do essay questions first and multiple choice last.)
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: This was a lot harder than it should have been for an introductory class. Group projects are awful, write a 10 page paper on an agency and create a nonprofit agency over the course of the year. This concept should be kept for nonprofit students. Everything is online but need to meet group almost weekly. Do not take.

Pick your group wisely! You will be with them for the remainder of the semester and two grades depend on group assignments. Class sucks, but survivable. She is a tough grader, but she has the materials there for you. DO the Readings, and Listen to her Lectures! Good Luck.

Always send you to her syllabus which is basically like a book. expect to do the work on your own. She barely clarifies anything. would never recommend her class. only taking it to unlock my major, she is making me reconsider that major good grief. prepare for stress and ignorance.

You will learn a lot from this class, but be prepared for a lot of busy work. Your group in this class will basically be your family for the semester since the assignments are due each week.  Get ready to work hard!
The class is hard but if you want to learn how this industry works, then take wade berg. Just make sure you have a solid group, that literally makes or breaks this class.

You're basically going to teach yourself. You also have a semester long, pointless group project. She  seems pretty narcissistic and always want to talk about herself. Slow grader. Tests are online but taken in a computer lab so she can make sure there's no cheating. Also Test are multiple choice, essay, and  short answer. Would not recommend.

WORST PROFESSOR I HAVE EVER TAKEN. Could care less about your grade. Not helpful. Semester long group projects that are completely pointless. Lectures are online and an hour and a half+ each. Too full of herself to actually help anyone. Only talked about herself and how much she deserved a raise. DO NOT TAKE.

This class is extremely hard for NO reason. She does not lecture in class so it's pretty much self taught. The exams are not easy at all. I think she expects this class to be the ONLY thing you have going on in your life. Try to take a different professor. Too hard for no reason at all.
Just overall hated this lady. I felt like this was hard class for no reason.

Do not take this class unless you absolutely have to. Try to wait for a different professor. She is rude and lazy. She does not teach, just reads power points. Her lectures are online and monotone. She expects too much for a intro class. Knowing that most HS majors are non-traditional and have jobs and lives, assigns way too much group work. RUN!

Must do the readings, and a lot of group work. Even though she seems tough, its for a good reason. If you are ready for a challenge, then this is the professor for you. If you want to breeze by, then don't bother. The class is very manageable, but don't expect an easy A. Big project at end, but guides you through the process.

I will agree that she is not easy at all. I worked very hard and learned a ton of information. She is in my top 2 best professors I've had. She expects a lot of her students. She knows a lot and I am very happy that I took her.

If you are interested in being challenged...take Wade-Berg. Her class isn't for folks who like to be spoon fed their class material. She sets the bar high, but gives you the tools to reach it...but lazy people need not take her course. Her teaching style was refreshing in a department that has yet to challenge me. Thank you Dr. Wade-Berg!

She doesn't really teach the class,but post pp online for you to watch. If you are a bad test taker do not take her class. you can pass multiple choice but if you don't answer the essay questions the way she want you to, then you don't pass the test.

does not care what you get in the class. if you ask her about something she'll tell you to read her 30-page syllabus and wont answer you. rude.  very difficult class, but it could be much easier- due to her teaching style. not punctual at all getting to class/posting assignments/grades but expects you to be. ive had her twice. wont do it again.

Heavy workload, semester-long group work, and indifference are what you get with this class. Every chapter must be read, there are nine assignments due through the semester, four tests, two papers, and a group presentation. While the work is do-able, her egotistic attitude will kill the class for you.

She really wasn't that bad. First off, you're going to have to read the book. . past the chapter summaries. The class won't seem that hard at first til the last few weeks so make sure you do really well prior to that. take opportunity of ALL the extra credits, it will help. I say take her, you'll learn tons! :) but be ready to put in the work!

Great Professor!! Not easy, but you will learn all about nonprofits. Made tough class fun,and treats you like an adult.Lets you pick top 3 exams out of 4.Study hard for first three and you won't have to take last exam.Group work important, so need a strong one.FEAR NOT!!

It is a very heavy load class with a lot of group work which you end up doing outside. She knows what she is talking about and she did show up late to online chat only ONCE out of 4 chats because she was sick, and she has been sick for the past month which is probably why she is slow on her grading.
Read the chapters, know you're vocabulary, don't expect her to clarify. She is very wordy and is late to class. Nice woman outside of class.

Nice person but, IF you want to be be completely stressed out w/ her teaching style and get a low grade take Wade-Berg. Essays need to be worded exactly, she doesn't teach, she reads from powerpts, is LATE on assignments, exam grades,  and to class but expects you to be on time, NO SHOW to online chats, Busy with other KSU respons.Read/Memorize.RUN

I would not recommend her.  She starts strong at the beginning of the semester and crashes halfway through.  She promises to post assignments that night and is three days late, exam grades are posted a week to a week and a half late, she is late to class and she doesn’t show up for all her 10pm online exam chats. She said she fell asleep.  Oops.
Love her. If you wan tot learn take her.  Whant an easy grade take another professor that just give a grade not education.
Tons of work

Dr. Wade-Berg's reputation precedes her. Yes, she teaches on somewhat of a graduate level, but it is for her students' benefit. She demands quality work and grades accordingly. She is approachable and helpful. You will earn your grade in her class; it is not a cake walk. If you're up to a challenge & want a good professor, choose her! Glad I did!

She is really good I liked her. She is very flexible on her assignments and takes the classes opinion as a whole into consideration when she changes stuff like case studies/test dates etc. She is really interesting and a pretty cool person. she is defiantly a person to look up to she has done so much in HS. I would take her again a

She teaches grad level material in an intro class, and expects us to comprehend and retain it all. Then grades us impossibly hard on tests and assignments. She only uses lawyer-ese so if you're prepared to be thrown into law school she's the one for you. if not, RUN!

Teaches you graduate level material at the undergraduate level. Class average for the first test was a 50 and she refused to drop that test because one person made an "A". She should be working in private industry and not teaching.  If you want no life take this class.

These people are crazy!! Dr.Wade-Berg is an EXCELLENT professor!! Explains everything and is always available. They're just mad bc she makes you work for your grade. She covers everything you are tested over or expected to do a case study for. Does take a bit too long to return assignments

Rec'd an "A", but had to work to get it, which does not happen in most HS Class, thanks for Dr. WB, I worked hard and learned alot. She knows her stuff on Nonprofits and will help when needed outside of class. Thank God she moved some of the due dates, it helped me personally. Great Class, so step out of your comfort zone and take the class!

Dr. Wade-Berg is an excellent professor.  She know her stuff and is willing to help outside of class if you don't understand something.  She is a very fair grader and will work the the class to adjust due-dates, test days, etc.  Take Dr. Wade-Berg if you get the chance!

Dr. Wade-Berg knows the information that she is teaching and the passion for the subject came across to her students. She is tough and excepts for her students to do their best on all assignments. She does move the due dates, but in our class they were moved per the classes request. Learned alot & worked hard, is the reason that we r n school!

ughhhhhhh This woman can dish it out but can't take it. She is super hard on students but can not do her job worth crap. She never communicates. She is late to site visits. She takes forever for corrections on assignments so much she has to push back dates. She has a huge attitude. I would say run... if you want your sanity.
Hard, but fair
YIKES! Run!!
